modelIdentification.name: NETN METOC
modelIdentification.purpose: The purpose of the NETN METOC module is to provide a standard way to exchange data related to weather conditions and primary effects of weather on terrain, on water surfaces, in the atmosphere and subsurface water conditions. The main objective is to provide a reference model that represents a core common subset of METOC related aspects and to allow extension of the module to incorporate additional detail if required. Therefore, the NETN METOC module shall be viewed as a reference FOM module where extensions are not only allowed but encouraged to fully meet federation specific requirements. However, any extension should also be considered as candidates for improving the NETN METOC module or candidates for new standard NETN modules.
modelIdentification.description:
NATO Education and Training Network (NETN) Meteorological and Oceanographic (METOC) Module.
This module is a specification of how to represent METOC related data to be shared among participants in a federated distributed simulation. The specification is based on IEEE 1516 High Level Architecture (HLA) Object Model Template (OMT) and primarily intended to support interoperability in a federated simulation (federation) based on HLA. An HLA OMT based Federation Object Model (FOM) is used to specify types of data and how it is encoded on the network. The NETN METOC FOM module is available as a XML file for use in HLA based federations.
modelIdentification.useLimitation: Current weather conditions impact simulations such as platforms and sensors on the ground, on the sea, under water and in the air. In a federated distributed simulation a correlated representation of these condistions is key to meet interoperability and model requirements. Different simulations require different fidelity of weather conditions with respect to data resolution and accuracy. The NETN METOC focus on representation of weather conditions related surfaces and layers. The main difference is that a surface condition does not have a volume and only represents the conditions directly related to the surface of a piece of terrain or water. The layer conditions represent a volume of water or air and is specified with hight/depth from surface and layer thickness. Both concepts are also geographically positioned by reference to other concepts shared in the federation such as position of objects, areal objects or reference to terrain features such as roads etc. Based on these concepts different levels of fidelity in representing weather conditions can be achieved. Global conditions can be expressed as well as highly detailed conditions e.g. surrounding a specific aircraft. The aspects and attributes of wather conditions included in the scope of the NETN METOC module is based on input from several sources and are designed to cover the most common levels of representation required by a large set of exising simulators. Tropospheric Layer Conditions cover the following aspects: Temperature, Winds, Precipitation, Haze, Humidity, Barometric Pressure, Visibility Range and Clouds. Water Layer Conditions cover the following aspects: Temperature, Salinity and Currents. Land Surface Conditions cover the following aspects: Temperature, Winds, Precipitation, Haze, Humidity, Barometric Pressure, Visibility Range, Snow Condition, Moisture and Ice Condition Water Surface Conditions cover the following aspects: Temperature, Winds, Precipitation, Haze, Humidity, Barometric Pressure, Visibility Range, Sea State, Salinity, Tide, Ice Conditions, Currents, Waves and Swell. Subsurface Layer Conditions cover the following aspects: Temperature, Current, Salinity and BottomType.
modelIdentification.useHistory: v1.0 - Initial version developed by MSG-163

poc.pocName: MSG-163 Evolution of NATO Standards for Federated Simulation

objectClass.name: METOC_Root
objectClass.semantics: Superclass for Environment Conditions and Layers.

attribute.name: UniqueId
attribute.semantics: Required. Unique identifier for the Environment Condition object or METOC Service.

attribute.name: Name
attribute.semantics: Optional. Name of the Environment Condition or METOC Service.

objectClass.name: EnvironmentCondition
objectClass.semantics:
Root class for all types of EnvironmentCondition objects.
The region where the EnvironmentCondition applies is defined by the GeoReference attribute, as follows.
If GeoReference is provided as a geographical area, and the sub class in question has surface semantics (water/land), the EnvironmentCondition applies only within that area of the surface.
If GeoReference is provided as a geographical area, and the sub class in question defines a Layer attribute, the EnvironmentCondition applies only within the volume bounded both by the Layer and by the body described by projecting each point of the area along a line through the center of the earth. (This means, e.g., that any volumes described by two adjacent geodetic quadrangles will never overlap, and if they belong to the same layer, will also be adjacent.)
If GeoReference is provided as a RPREntityReference, NETNEntityReference or GMLFeatureReference identifying a feature (as opposed to a geometry object), the EnvironmentCondition is considered to apply only to the immediate vicinity of the referenced entity/feature: any Layer attribute specified by a sub class is ignored in this case.
If not provided, the EnvironmentCondition is considered global, only restricted by the semantics of its particular sub class.

attribute.name: ServiceId
attribute.semantics: Required. Identifies the METOC Service which produced the EnvironmentCondition object.

attribute.name: GeoReference
attribute.semantics: Optional. A geographical location, region, feature or simulated object.

objectClass.name: Weather
objectClass.semantics: Information about the general weather condition can be represented using WeatherCondition objects. Common data such as Temperature, Wind and Precipitaion is represented but also details regarding Barometric Pressure and Humidity. Information about Visual Range and Haze conditions can also be represented. All attributes of WeatherCondition objects are optional. An instance of this class without a GeoReference is considered global above sea level.

attribute.name: Temperature
attribute.semantics: Optional. Temperature in the region/location specified by the EnvironmentCondition. If EnvironmentConditions with overlapping regions/locations exist the average temperature should be used.

attribute.name: Wind
attribute.semantics: Optional. Wind speed and direction in the region/location specified by the EnvironmentCondition. If EnvironmentConditions with overlapping regions/locations exist the average wind speed and direction should be used.

attribute.name: Precipitation
attribute.semantics: Optional. Current precipitation type and intensity in the region/location specified by the Environment Condition. Default is No Precipitation. If EnvironmentConditions with overlapping regions/locations exist the average intensity should be used. Conflicting precipitation types are resolved according to the following precedence: Snow, Hail, Rain, No Precipitation. E.g. If there is one overlapping Environment Condition with Snow the result is always Snow.

attribute.name: Haze
attribute.semantics: Optional. Current Haze type and density in the region/location specified by the Environment Condition. Default is No Haze. If EnvironmentConditions with overlapping regions/locations exist having the same Haze type the average density should be used.

attribute.name: Humidity
attribute.semantics: Optional. Humidity in percent in the region/location specified by the Environment Condition. Default is 75% (Normal value) If EnvironmentConditions with overlapping regions/locations exist the average humidity should be used.

attribute.name: BarometricPressure
attribute.semantics: Optional. Barometric pressure measured in millibar or hectopascal (1 mbar = 1hPa) in the region/location specified by the Environment Condition. If EnvironmentConditions with overlapping regions/locations exist the average barometric pressure should be used.

attribute.name: VisibilityRange
attribute.semantics: Optional. The distance at which an object or light can be clearly discerned by the human eye in the region/location specified by the Environment Condition. If EnvironmentConditions with overlapping regions/locations exist the minimum distance should be used.

objectClass.name: LandSurface
objectClass.semantics: The environment conditions related to a land surface. Besides the common attributes such as Temperature, Wind and Precipitaion etc. additional detail regarding snow, moisture, and ice conditions of the land surface can be represented. All attributes of LandSurfaceCondition objects are optional. An instance of this class without a GeoReference is considered to apply to all land surfaces.

attribute.name: Snow
attribute.semantics: Optional. Current snow depth and density in the region/location specified by the EnvironmentCondition. Default is no snow. If EnvironmentConditions with overlapping regions/locations exist the average snow depth and density should be used.

attribute.name: Moisture
attribute.semantics: Optional. Surface moisture in the region/location specified by the EnvironmentCondition. Default is 0 (Dry). If EnvironmentConditions with overlapping regions/locations exist, moisture is calculated as the highest enumerated value making the resulting value the one with most moisture.

attribute.name: IceCondition
attribute.semantics: Optional. Surface ice condition in the region/location specified by the EnvironmentCondition. Default is no ice. If EnvironmentConditions with overlapping regions/locations exist, surface ice condition is calculated as the highest enumerated value making the resulting value the one with the most severe ice condition.

objectClass.name: WaterSurface
objectClass.semantics: Condition of sea surface in the specified region. An instance of this class without a GeoReference is considered to apply to all water surfaces.

attribute.name: SeaState
attribute.semantics: Optional. State of sea surface. Default is Calm_glassy. If EnvironmentConditions with overlapping regions/locations exist, the sea state in the overlapping region is determined by the latest updated value.

attribute.name: Salinity
attribute.semantics: Optional. Salinity of sea water on the practical salinity scale 1978 (PSS-78). Default value is 35 (equivalent to 35 parts per thousand). If EnvironmentConditions with overlapping regions/locations exist the average salinity should be used.

attribute.name: Tide
attribute.semantics: Optional. The height of the current tide relative to MSL. Default is 0. If EnvironmentConditions with overlapping regions/locations exist, the value for the overlapping region is the average Tide value.

attribute.name: Ice
attribute.semantics: Optional. Ice condition on surface. Default is no ice. If EnvironmentConditions with overlapping regions/locations exist, the ice condition in the overlapping region is determined by the latest updated value.

attribute.name: Current
attribute.semantics: Optional. Current on water surface. Default is no current. Ignored if surface has 100% Ice coverage. If EnvironmentConditions with overlapping regions/locations exist, the current in the overlapping region is the average current direction and speed.

attribute.name: Wave
attribute.semantics: Optional. Waves on the water surface. Default is no waves. Ignored if surface has 100% Ice coverage. If EnvironmentConditions with overlapping regions/locations exist, the wave condition in the overlapping region is determined by the latest updated value.

attribute.name: Swell
attribute.semantics: Optional. Swell of the body of water. Default is no Swell. Ignored if surface has 100% Ice coverage. If EnvironmentConditions with overlapping regions/locations exist, the swell condition in the overlapping region is determined by the latest updated value.

objectClass.name: TroposphereLayer
objectClass.semantics: If overlapping Atmospheric Conditions exist the following merging rules apply: Humidity, AirTemperature and BarometricPressure are calculated as the average of the overlapping conditions. Visibility is calculated as the minimum visibility distance of the overlapping conditions. A TroposhpereLayer instance without a GeoReference is considered global within its specified Layer.

attribute.name: Layer
attribute.semantics: Optional. Volume of atmosphere extending from a base altitude upwards (see LayerStruct). Any portion of the Layer extending below sea level is ignored. If Layer is not provided, it is considered to extend from the surface of the earth upward indefinitely.

attribute.name: Cloud
attribute.semantics: Optional. Data about Clouds in the Atmospheric layer. Default is no clouds. If EnvironmentConditions with overlapping regions/locations exist, the cloud condition in the overlapping region is determined by the latest updated value.

objectClass.name: SubsurfaceLayer
objectClass.semantics: EnvironmentCondition of a subsurface water layer. If GeoReference is not provided, the condition is considered global within the specified Layer.

attribute.name: Temperature
attribute.semantics: Optional. Temperature in the region/location specified by the EnvironmentCondition. If EnvironmentConditions with overlapping regions/locations exist the average temperature should be used.

attribute.name: Layer
attribute.semantics: Optional. A body of water extending from a (negative) base altitude upwards (see LayerStruct). Any portion of the Layer extending above sea level is ignored. If Layer is not provided, it is considered to extend from the sea floor to the surface of the water.

attribute.name: Current
attribute.semantics: Optional. Describes current in the water layer. Default is no current. If EnvironmentConditions with overlapping regions/locations exist the average current direction and speed should be used.

attribute.name: Salinity
attribute.semantics: Optional. Salinity of sea water on the practical salinity scale 1978 (PSS-78). Default value is 35 (equivalent to 35 parts per thousand). If EnvironmentConditions with overlapping regions/locations exist the average salinity should be used.

attribute.name: BottomType
attribute.semantics: Optional. Type of sediment on the sea floor. Default is NoSediment. If EnvironmentConditions with overlapping regions/locations exist, the sediment type in the overlapping region is determined by the latest updated value.

objectClass.name: Service
objectClass.semantics: All systems providing EnvironmentCondition information as either object instances or as responses to service requests must register a Service object instance.

attribute.name: ModelType
attribute.semantics: Required. Type of METOC model provided by the Service. Specifies whether the Service delivers Simulated, Real (Historical), Live (Current) or Standard model data.

interactionClass.name: METOC_Interaction
interactionClass.semantics: Root class for requesting environment data from a METOC Service.

parameter.name: EventId
parameter.semantics: Required: Unique identifier of the request. Will be referenced in a resulting resulting METOC_Response interaction.

interactionClass.name: Request
interactionClass.semantics: A request to a specified METOC Service to provide METOC data for a specific geographical reference. The request can result in either a response interaction including the requested data or registration of an EnvironmentCondition object for continuous updates.

parameter.name: GeoReference
parameter.semantics: Optional. Geographical reference to indicate for which point, area, path or object this request is related to. If not provided, the request is for a global environment condition.

parameter.name: UpdateAsObject
parameter.semantics: Optional. Indicates if the service is requested to represent the environment condition as an EnvironmentCondition object instance. Default is False.

parameter.name: ServiceId
parameter.semantics: Required: Unique identifier of the model used for providing METOC information. Multiple Models may exist.

interactionClass.name: RequestLandSurfaceCondition
interactionClass.semantics: Request for land surface condition data.

interactionClass.name: RequestTroposphereLayerCondition
interactionClass.semantics: Request for tropospheric environment condition data.

parameter.name: Layer
parameter.semantics: Optional. A description of layer for request of layered conditions troposphere environment condition. Default is the entire volume of air in the identified area.

interactionClass.name: RequestWaterSurfaceCondition
interactionClass.semantics: Request for water surface condition data.

parameter.name: Layer
parameter.semantics: Optional. A description of layer for request of layered subsurface environment conditions. Default is the entire body of water in the identified area.

interactionClass.name: Response
interactionClass.semantics: Response to a RequestEnvironmentCondition. RequestId paramater should match the corresponding parameter in the request.

parameter.name: EnvironmentObjectId
parameter.semantics: Optional. Reference to an existing environment condition object if the corresponding request includes UpdateAsObject set to true.

parameter.name: GeoReference
parameter.semantics: Optional. Geographical reference to indicate for which point, area, path or object this request is related to. Default if not provided the environment condition data is global.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.semantics: Required: Specifies the result of the request action. TRUE indicates success.

interactionClass.name: WeatherCondition
interactionClass.semantics: Response with general weather condition data.

parameter.name: Temperature
parameter.semantics: Optional. Average temperature in the region/location.

parameter.name: Wind
parameter.semantics: Optional. Average wind speed and direction in the region/location.

parameter.name: Precipitation
parameter.semantics: Optional. Average precipitation intensisty region/location for a precipitation type in the following order of precedence Snow, Hail, Rain, NoPrecipitation.

parameter.name: Haze
parameter.semantics: Optional. Average haze density in the region/location,

parameter.name: Humidity
parameter.semantics: Optional. Average humidity in percent in the region/location.

parameter.name: BarometricPressure
parameter.semantics: Optional. Average barometric pressure measured in millibar or hectopascal (1 mbar = 1hPa) in the region/location.

parameter.name: VisibilityRange
parameter.semantics: Optional. Average distance at which an object or light can be clearly discerned by the human eye in the region/location.

interactionClass.name: LandSurfaceCondition
interactionClass.semantics: Response with condition for land surface.

parameter.name: Snow
parameter.semantics: Optional. Average snow depth and density in the region/location.

parameter.name: Moisture
parameter.semantics: Optional. Maximum surface moisture in the region/location.

parameter.name: IceCondition
parameter.semantics: Optional. Most severe ice condition in the region/location.

interactionClass.name: TroposphereLayerCondition
interactionClass.semantics: Response with environment condition in volume of air.

parameter.name: Cloud
parameter.semantics: Optional. Cloud cover.

interactionClass.name: WaterSurfaceCondition
interactionClass.semantics: Response with water surface condition data.

parameter.name: SeaState
parameter.semantics: Optional. Sea state data.

parameter.name: Salinity
parameter.semantics: Optional. Salinity in the surface water.

parameter.name: Tide
parameter.semantics: Optional. The height relative to the MSL.

parameter.name: Ice
parameter.semantics: Optional. Ice conditions on the water surface.

parameter.name: Current
parameter.semantics: Optional. Surface water Current direction and speed. N/A if Ice

parameter.name: Wave
parameter.semantics: Optional. Surface Wave data. N/A if Ice

parameter.name: Swell
parameter.semantics: Optional. Surface water Swell data. N/A if Ice

interactionClass.name: SubsurfaceLayerCondition
interactionClass.semantics: Response with subsurface body of water condition data.

parameter.name: Temperature
parameter.semantics: Optional. Average temperature in the body of water.

parameter.name: Current
parameter.semantics: Optional. Average current direction and speed in the body of water.

parameter.name: Salinity
parameter.semantics: Optional. Average salinity in the body of water.

parameter.name: BottomType
parameter.semantics: Optional. Type of sediment on the sea floor. Default is 0 (NoSediment). If EnvironmentConditions with overlapping regions/locations exist, the sediment type in the overlapping region is determined by the latest updated value.

simpleData.name: PrecipitationIntensityFloat32
simpleData.semantics: Light rain â when the precipitation rate is < 2.5 mm (0.098 in) per hour. Moderate rain â when the precipitation rate is between 2.5 mm (0.098 in) - 7.6 mm (0.30 in) or 10 mm (0.39 in) per hour. Heavy rain â when the precipitation rate is > 7.6 mm (0.30 in) per hour, or between 10 mm (0.39 in) and 50 mm (2.0 in) per hour. Violent rain â when the precipitation rate is > 50 mm (2.0 in) per hour.

simpleData.name: AtmosphericPressureFloat32
simpleData.semantics: Pressure measured in Millibar or Hecto Pascal. 1 mbar = 1 hPa

simpleData.name: SalinityFloat32
simpleData.semantics: Practical Salinity Unit (PSU) measured in g/kg.

enumeratedData.name: CloudTypeEnum32
enumeratedData.semantics: Classification of different types of clouds.

enumeratedData.name: SurfaceMoistureEnum16
enumeratedData.semantics: Road surface wetness or soil moisture.

enumeratedData.name: SeaStateEnum16
enumeratedData.semantics: State of the sea measured in Douglas Sea Scale.

enumeratedData.name: WeatherModelTypeEnum32
enumeratedData.semantics: Type of weather model used by a METOC service.

enumeratedData.name: SedimentTypeEnum32
enumeratedData.semantics: The type of sediment on the sea floor.

fixedRecordData.name: WaveStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Water surface wave conditions and direction.

field.name: Length
field.semantics: Distance from a particular phase on a wave to the same phase on an adjacent wave.

field.name: Height
field.semantics: Average vertical distance between trough and crest produced by the wave.

field.name: Period
field.semantics: Wave period is the distance between two waves passing through a stationary point, measured in seconds.

field.name: Direction
field.semantics: The direction in which the wave propagates.

field.name: Direction
field.semantics: Direction of current.

field.name: Speed
field.semantics: Speed of current.

fixedRecordData.name: IceStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Ice type, thickness and coverage on water surface.

field.name: Type
field.semantics: Type of ice on water surface.

field.name: Thickness
field.semantics: Thickness of ice on water surface.

field.name: Coverage
field.semantics: Ice coverage on water surface.

fixedRecordData.name: CloudStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Description of cloud layer type, coverage and density.

field.name: Type
field.semantics: Type of cloud

field.name: Coverage
field.semantics: Cloud coverage as percent.

field.name: Density
field.semantics: Average density of clouds.

fixedRecordData.name: LayerStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: A layer of the Earth's environment expressed as a base altitude and a thickness.

field.name: Base
field.semantics: The altitude of the bottom end of the layer, in meters above mean sea level (MSL). Negative values means the base is below mean sea level.

field.name: Thickness
field.semantics: Thickness of the layer in meters above the base altitude. Always a positive value.

field.name: Direction
field.semantics: Required: Direction in degrees clockwise from due north.

field.name: HorizontalSpeed
field.semantics: Required: Wind speed (m/s) in the specified WindDirection.

field.name: VerticalSpeed
field.semantics: Optional. Wind speed in m/s. Negative number is a downdraft. Default is 0.

field.name: Type
field.semantics: Type of precipitation.

field.name: Intensity
field.semantics: Amount of precipitation in mm/per hour.

fixedRecordData.name: SnowStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Depth and density of snow cover.

field.name: Depth
field.semantics: Snow depth on terrain.

field.name: Density
field.semantics: kg/m3

fixedRecordData.name: HazeStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Type and density of haze material.

field.name: Type
field.semantics: Type of Haze.

field.name: Density
field.semantics: Concentration/Density of haze measured in Kg/m3.

variantRecordData.name: GeoReferenceVariant

alternative.name: GeodeticLocation
alternative.semantics: A location on the surface of the earth defined by lat, lon WGS84.

alternative.name: GeodeticCircle
alternative.semantics: A geodetic point and radius specifying a circle on the surface of the earth WGS84 where the radius is a great circle distance on the surface.

alternative.name: GeodeticQuadrangle
alternative.semantics: A latitude-longitude quadrangle is a region bounded by two meridians and two parallels.

alternative.name: GeodeticPolygon
alternative.semantics: A polygon on the surface of the earth defined by a number of great-circle arcs represented as lat, lon Locations. WGS84.

alternative.name: NETNGeoObjectReference
alternative.semantics: Reference to an object instance of class Location, Path or Region, defined in NETN-SE FOM Module or a NETN Physical or Aggregate entity with UUID.

alternative.name: RPREntityReference
alternative.semantics: Reference to an instance of a leaf node subclass of RPR-FOM BaseEntity by its EntityIdentifier. E.g. an Aircraft, SurfaceVessel etc.

alternative.name: GMLFeatureReference
alternative.semantics: Reference to a GML feature by its GML Identifier.

variantRecordData.semantics: The area affected by an Environment Condition can be expressed as: - a location on the earth's surface represented by a Point, - an area on the earth's surface, represented by a Quadrangle, GeodeticPolygon, or GeodeticCircle, or - a reference to some other object/data. Objects that can be referenced are RPR entities, NETN entities, NETN-SE GeoObjects and GML Features.

note.label: netn-metoc_2
note.semantics:
Environment conditions are represented as object instances in the federation. Each instance is related to one of the following: Global condition (no GeoReference), condition related to specific object instance (RPR BaseEntity or Environment Object), explicitly defined geographical areas (Polygon or Circle) or a reference to WFS/GML identifier.
Environment Condition Objects are either surface based (land or water) or a layer (above terrain or below water surface).
Environment Condition Objects include either Weather attributes or Sub Surface (Water) attributes.
Environment Condition Objects are created by any federate to express need for environmental information. Ownership of environmental object attributes are divested to Weather Service federate(s) with the modelling responsibility of correlated environment conditions.
